system_overview: A tetrad analysis system with 57 scenario templates, using McLuhan's four laws (Enhance/Obsolesce/Retrieve/Reverse) as operators on a 9×9 invariant grid substrate.

mindsets_paradigms.current: Technology simply enhances; futures are linear extrapolations
mindsets_paradigms.target: Technology simultaneously enhances, obsolesces, retrieves, reverses
mindsets_paradigms.intervention: Habituate tetrad thinking through structured scenarios

organizing_principles.target: Invariant 9×9 substrate that scales without accumulating
organizing_principles.intervention: Be parasitic off existing worlds rather than build new ones

information_flows.current: Scenario exploration is individual; no pattern sharing
information_flows.target: Cross-user visibility into which branches get explored
information_flows.intervention: Ring buffer logs exploration; surfaces unexplored regions

system_infrastructure.target: Ring buffer provides bounded persistent state

dynamic_processes.embedded_values: Futures thinking rewards novelty over depth; extrapolation over reversal
dynamic_processes.process_redesign_opportunity: Tetrad operators force consideration of all four laws

social_positionalities.power_dynamics: Foresight consultants hold expertise; clients defer to method
social_positionalities.legitimized_expertise: McLuhan media ecology legitimizes non-linear thinking

invisible_work.articulation_labor: Translating tetrad theory into 57 scenario templates
invisible_work.emotional_labor: Managing client expectations when scenarios are uncomfortable

tilth_failure_analysis.what_failed: TILTH speculative company (Agronica) collapsed under complexity
tilth_failure_analysis.root_cause: World-building accumulates context faster than coherence can maintain
tilth_failure_analysis.lesson_learned: Invariant patterns scale; parasitic approach more sustainable
tilth_failure_analysis.key_insight: Better speculative worlds already exist (Ted Chiang, Life After Bob); use them

integrated_intervention_strategies.infrastructure_work: McLuhan's four laws as forced consideration; scenarios reveal what 'reverses' at extremes
Same structure works for any domain; complexity bounded by design
Network of scenario analysts sharing tetrad patterns; 'when X enhances Y, it often obsolesces Z'

visible_trail.observation: Higher visibility—ring buffer development shows iteration

invisible_trail: 'Aha moment' that worlds should be borrowed, not built
Ted Chiang and Life After Bob as parasite worlds
McLuhan tetrad as the invariant operator set

meta_rule: Analyze technology futures by asking: What does this technology enhance, obsolesce, retrieve, and reverse (all simultaneously), AND what infrastructural conditions (consulting incentives, planning cycles, organizational risk tolerance) shape which futures are thinkable?
